name: Garlic Butter Herb Chicken with Velvety Onion Sauce
description: Juicy pan-seared and oven-baked chicken thighs with a rich, velvety onion sauce made from the pan juices.

ingredients.name: red or yellow onion, thinly sliced

instructions: Pat the chicken thighs dry with paper towels.
In a small bowl, mix together salt, black pepper, paprika, thyme, oregano, and parsley. Rub evenly onto the chicken.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear chicken smooth side down for 1 minute, then flip and sear for another 1 minute.
In a lightly greased baking dish, scatter the sliced onion on the bottom.
Arrange the seared chicken on top of the onions.
Dot the butter pieces around and on top of the chicken.
Sprinkle minced garlic, lemon zest, and lemon juice over everything.
Pour chicken broth into the dish for moisture.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20 minutes, basting with pan juices at the 10-minute mark.
Once baked, remove the chicken from the baking dish and set it aside on serving plates.
Pour all the onions and pan juices into a saucepan over medium heat.
In the now-empty baking dish, melt 1 tbsp butter and whisk in 1 tbsp flour to form a roux.
Slowly pour in the reserved pan juices and onions, whisking continuously until smooth and slightly thickened.
Simmer for 2-3 minutes until the sauce reaches a silky consistency.
Drizzle the velvety onion sauce over the plated chicken.
Garnish with fresh parsley, scallions, or cilantro if desired.
notes: If using a cold smoker, smoke the chicken for 15-20 minutes with mild wood before seasoning and searing.
For extra richness, replace water with chicken broth or white wine.
Pairs well with mashed potatoes, rice, or crusty bread.
